item.title: Area, 15th February
item.description:
From junction Downham Way up to 41 Capstone Road foot path not been cleaned for months. Furniture with Lewisham yellow tape been there over 3 weeks.. Haven't seen a road sweep in area before Christmas. People from 27 Capstone Road dump plaster bits on footpath
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Capstone Road, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike still not picked up, 15th February
item.description:
Please pick this bike up, it has been here for over a week. it has already been marked as abandoned.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kingsland Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken Bench on Stamford Hill, 15th February
item.description:
Near Lynmouth Road bus stop there is a bench which is broken. It is missing two wooden panels on the seating area. This needs fixing, it makes the borough look desolate as well as being unhelpful to people that need a seat.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stamford Hill, Stamford Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Bus Station - Damage to road or pavement within the Bus Station

item.title: Oxted Court - all lights out. Unsafe, 15th February
item.description:
All of the lights on Oxted Court are broken/not working. This applies all of the lights for the upstairs flats and the lights up the stairs. This is incredibly unsafe. This happens regularly, please don't just change the bulbs, changes the fixtures.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hindhead Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.title: Blocked drains, 15th February
item.description:
I have reported this numerous of time with no avail. Today Sunday 15th February, I have reported it again and had a response in hours explaining you have tried to complete this job but cars are blocking the drains. Today there are 3 cars in this car park and during the week there may be 4 or 5. The drains are in the middle of the car park where cars need to drive in and out, Therefore, I find it hard to believe that cars are blocking the drains. Can you Please Log this as a new order to have this issue fixed before someone slips and injures themselves and the the water overflows into the main road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Red Barracks Road, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish pile building - keeps growing, 15th February
item.description:
There is a pile of rubbish that has been growing for the last two weeks, started off with cardboard boxes, grew to furniture and mattress as you can see. At one point there was a needle within the stack of rubbish. Unsure what is happening to it. As said it’s been growing for a couple weeks now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 408, York Way, Holloway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass scattered across public footpath, 15th February
item.description:
There has been belongings left outside the property for ‘people to take’ by unknown. There was glass amongst the things which have been smashed across the footpath. Belongings have been there since Friday 13th and glass smashed anywhere between Saturday Night and today.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 408, York Way, Holloway, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This pile of rubbish is only getting bigger, 15th February
item.description:
After council introduced rubbish clearance every 2 weeks it’s only gotten worse. I get a pleasant surprise if don’t see newly dumped rubbish laying around when go to work in the morning. It’s that bad!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newmarsh Road, Thamesmead
